stage.emph: Jory enters. In a huff. Returning for Isaac and her things. Ready to leave for the evening -

body.u: Isaac, we need to get out of here -

stage.emph: - but stopped in place by the moment of intimacy between her husband and Emily.

body.u: Honey?
What the fuck is going on here?

stage.emph: Amir enters, inflamed.

body.u: You wait a week to tell me this? And the second I say something you don't like hearing, you walk away from me in mid-fucking sentence? Who are you?!

stage.emph: Jory just stares at her husband...

body.u: (cont'd) What? (Looking around) What?
(To Emily) Are you having an affair with my husband?
Excuse me?
(To Jory) Nobody's having an affair.
I walked in here and they were kissing.
That is not true! Amir, it's not true.
They were kissing.(Pointing) There.
That's not what was happening.
I know what I saw.
Isaac told me about them making you partner. I know how much longer Amir has been there than you. I was upset. I was crying.
I was consoling her.
By kissing her?
(Incredulous) We weren't kissing! Why do you keep saying that?!
(To Isaac) Are you having an affair with her? Tell me the truth.
Honey. I already said. We're not having an affair.
So what the fuck were you doing when I walked in here?
(Going to his wife) I was hugging her because she was crying.
Get off me!
I was upset they made you partner. I know how much longer Amir has been there. I was crying.

stage.emph: Amir turns to Jory. Vicious.

body.u: First you steal my job and now you try to destroy my marriage? You're fucking evil. After everything I've done for you?

stage.emph: Jory goes over to get her purse. As if to leave.

body.u: I know what I saw.

(Exploding) You have any idea how much of myself I've poured into that place? That closet at the end of the hall? Where they keep the cleaning supplies? That was my first office! Yours had a view of the fucking park! Your first three years? Were you ever at work before anyone else in the morning? Were you ever the last one to leave? Cause if you were, I didn't see it. I still leave the office after you do! You think you're the nigger here? I'm the nigger!! Me!!
(Going to his wife) You don't need to listen to any more out of this asshole.
(To Isaac) Don't touch me.
(To Isaac) You're the asshole.
You better shut your mouth, buddy!
(To Isaac) Or what?!
Or I'll knock you on your fucking ass!
Try me!
(To Isaac)Get off me!!

stage.emph: Inflamed, Isaac finally releases his wife, facing off with Amir.
When suddenly - Amir spits in Isaac's face. Beat. Isaac wipes the spit from his face.
Beat.
Isaac wipes the spit from his face.

body.u: There's a reason they call you people animals.

stage.emph: Isaac turns to his wife. Then turns to Emily. Then walks out.

body.u: (To Jory) Get out.

(Collecting her things) There's something you should know. Your dear friend Mort is retiring. And guess who's taking over his caseload? Not you. Me. I asked him, Why not Amir? He said something about you being duplicitous. That it's why you're such a good litigator. But that it's impossible to trust you. (At the door) You don't believe me? Call Mort. Ask him yourself. Let me guess. He hasn't been taking your calls?

stage.emph: Jory walks out. Pause.

body.u: Have you lost your fucking mind?!

stage.emph: Amir turns away, withdrawing into himself. Pacing. The inward spiral deepening.

body.u: (cont'd) Amir!
She's right. He hasn't been taking my calls.
I'm gonna get you that coffee.

stage.emph: Emily heads for the kitchen...
Leaving Amir onstage by himself for a moment. As he watches the swinging door sway. Back and forth.
Emily returns. A mug in hand.

body.u: Em.

stage.emph: Something in Amir's tone - vulnerable, intense - stops her in place.

body.u: (cont'd) Are you sleeping with him?

stage.emph: Pause.
Emily puts the mug down on the table.
Beat. Finally shakes her head.

body.u: It was in London. When I was at Frieze. We were drinking. It's not an excuse... It's just... We'd been to the Victoria and Albert. He was talking about my work. And...

stage.emph: Emily - seeing how her words are landing on her husband - makes her way to him.

body.u: (cont'd)(Approaching) Amir, I'm so disgusted with myself. If I could take it back.

stage.emph: All at once, Amir hits Emily in the face. A vicious blow.
The first blow unleashes a torrent of rage, overtaking him. He hits her twice more. Maybe a third. In rapid succession. Uncontrolled violence of discreetly building resentment.
(In order for the stage violence to seem as real as possible, obscuring it from direct view of the audience might be necessary. For it to unfold with Emily hidden by a couch, for example.)
After the last blow, Amir suddenly comes to his senses, realizing what he's done.

body.u: Oh, my God...
